Log in for a golden opportunity

They say money can't buy happiness, but maybe the other great login rewards can help with that. In the meantime, you can enjoy a boon of 50,000 gold for logging in at least 21 days this month. Buy yourself something nice!


From arcane mysteries to stylish frippery, there's a lot going on with these rewards. Which one are you most excited about? You can let us know via X (formerly Twitter), Instagram, and Facebook.

item.title: Anniversary Spotlight—Venture into Vvardenfell & Seht's Realm
item.description: Claim a free Customized Action by completing the Morrowind storyline, plus receive the Clockwork City DLC for free with Daily Login Rewards this July!
item.content:encoded:
Claim a free Customized Action by completing the Morrowind storyline, plus receive the Clockwork City DLC for free with Daily Login Rewards this July!

Recall in Autumnal Style

The 10-Year Anniversary Celebration continues with a new spotlight, and this time, we're taking you and your allies to the Dark Elf island home of Vvardenfell and Sotha Sil's world in miniature. From July 2 until August 15, you can unlock the ability to claim the Gold Road Recall Customized Action for FREE from the in-game Crown Store when you complete the Champion of Vivec Achievement.

Gold Road Recall

Customized Actions allow you to change the animation and effects for specific in-game actions, such as harvesting and, in this case, recalling. To earn the Champion of Vivec Achievement, complete the Vvardenfell zone storyline and restore the demi-god's lost power.

Claim Clockwork City

In addition to the Customized Action, you can also unlock the Clockwork City DLC free with July's Daily Login Rewards. Simply log in during the month of July and claim the DLC on Day 2—easy!

Venture into Clockwork City

In the Clockwork City DLC, you can explore one of Seht's most incredible (and dangerous) creations: an entire world in miniature. This unique zone has its own storyline, challenges, and characters to discover, plus it's a long-time favorite of the ESO community. If you've not yet had the chance to explore the Clockwork City (or are yet to own the DLC outright), this is your opportunity to do so!

Endeavor into Morrowind

During the Anniversary Spotlight period, you can also enjoy themed Endeavors, allowing you to earn Seals by completing activities such as destroying clockwork foes, slaying public dungeon bosses in Vvardenfell, clearing the Halls of Fabrication, and more. Keep an eye out for them!

Complete Endeavors in Vvardenfell

Celebrate the Home of the Dark Elves

item.title: Feedback On Console Environmental Sustainability Features
item.content:encoded:
Hi all. We're gathering some feedback regarding the Environmental Sustainability Features added in U42. Specifically, we would like feedback on the following patch note:
  • Reduced GPU use in Contextual Menus (Xbox Series X|S and PS5): When viewing most menus, (eg. managing inventory, achievements, quest journal, etc) framerate is now capped to 30fps. Some menus are exempt on a case-by-case basis (eg. conversations, various mini-games). Testing in Performance Mode while in these menus shows a 50% reduction in GPU consumption, resulting in overall power consumption going from approximately 63% of the maximum possible on a console down to 37%.
We're seeing your feedback about menus capped to 30fps is causing issues for some of you. Please let us know how it is impacting your play experience. We are sharing this with our teams to better inform them of your feedback and how we can improve the experience overall. Additionally, if you are experiencing other framerate issues with either your menus or player character, please note those here as well. Thanks, all.

item.title: The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road & Update 42 Now Live on All Platforms
item.description: Uncover the mystery of the Forgotten Prince with The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road and Update 42 base-game patch, now live on all platforms!
item.content:encoded:
Uncover the mystery of the Forgotten Prince with The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road and Update 42 base-game patch, now live on all platforms!

The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road is now live on PC/Mac, Steam, Epic Game Store, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4, and PlayStation 5. This new Chapter for The Elder Scrolls Online introduces a new zone to explore, West Weald, along with a new system to master called Scribing. It also concludes the story of Ithelia, the Forgotten Prince, which began with 2023's Shadows Over Morrowind saga.

The Forgotten Prince returns

In addition to the Chapter, this release also includes the U42 base-game patch, introducing a host of bug fixes, balance changes, and other improvements free for all ESO players. You can view the full patch notes for Gold Road and Update 42 on our official forums.

Gold Road Chapter

In The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road you can venture into the heart of Colovian Imperial culture as you unravel the mystery of the return of a never-before-seen Daedric Prince—Ithelia. While Gold Road continues (and concludes) the Shadow Over Morrowind narrative that began in 2023, you can experience and enjoy the latest Chapter's storyline without having to play any of the game's previous content.

West Weald Zone

Located along Cyrodiil's southwest border and neighboring Valenwood and the Gold Coast, this new Chapter allows you to explore West Weald, a wealthy Imperial province thrown into chaos. Home to the proud and cosmopolitan Colovians, West Weald has found itself besieged by mysterious unknown Daedra. Even worse, a large part of the region has seemingly overnight become overgrown by the vast jungles of Valenwood, resulting in the migration of local Wood Elves.

Within this new zone, you can explore the city of Skingrad in addition to both the Gold Road region and emergent Dawnwood, where you'll discover a multitude of new side quests, world bosses, delves, public dungeons, and more. Discover more about the zone in this preview blog.

Scribing System

An all-new system introduced with Gold Road, Scribing grants you the ability to craft and customize your own handmade abilities. With Scribing, you can select a base Grimoire and tailor it with scripts to create an ability that perfectly fits your playstyle and build.

With this new system, you'll discover a robust questline that has you restore an ancient Scholarium while diving deep into the mysteries of magicka in Tamriel. Whether you're looking for greater power, versatility, or roleplaying opportunities, Scribing introduces a powerful new way to tailor your builds and play your way.

Group Activities

In addition to the zone's multiple world bosses, delves, and public dungeons, Gold Road also introduces two new group activities to challenge you and your allies: the Lucent Citadel and Mirrormoor Incursions.

In the Lucent Citadel Trial, you and your large group (12 players total) must venture into a long-forgotten Daedric vault within the realm of Fargrave, contend with its unique boss encounters, and seek out the mysterious Arcane Knot.

Team up to defend West Weald

Mirrormoor Incursions are a new type of world event plaguing West Weald and threatening to overwhelm the region with the minions of Ithelia. You can discover more about both activities in this preview blog.

New Rewards

In addition to a new zone to explore, stories to experience, and challenges to overcome, the Gold Road Chapter is full of new Achievements, items, and collectibles for you to loot and earn.

Specifically, West Weald features 10 powerful item sets to loot and craft in addition to three unique Mythic items to uncover using the Antiquities system. Completing Achievements can also earn you a wide range of collectibles, such as style pages for King Nantharion's Royal Armor or even the Wildburn Lynx mount.

New collectibles, styles, and more

Rewards also include fragments for the all-new Tales of Tribute patron and deck, Saint Alessia, in addition to a new type of collectible, called Skill Styles. Skill Styles are cosmetic collectibles that allow you to change the visuals for your existing abilities. With Gold Road and Update 42, there are 22 Skill Styles for you to unlock and apply from various sources, including quest rewards, public dungeons, and other activities.

Great challenges lead to great rewards!

Finally, Gold Road and Update 42 also introduces the Adventurer Across a Decade Achievement, celebrating ESO's 10-Year Anniversary by granting you the Fractured Glory skin for having completed the game's story content (including Gold Road) throughout its long history.

Purchase Details & Requirements

The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road is available to buy now, with four editions:

  • The Elder Scrolls Online Deluxe Collection: Gold Road
  • The Elder Scrolls Online Collection: Gold Road
  • The Elder Scrolls Online Deluxe Upgrade: Gold Road
  • The Elder Scrolls Online: Upgrade: Gold Road

If you are a brand-new or lapsed player, both Collection editions include the base game, the Gold Road Chapter, and ALL previous Chapters. If you already own ESO and its previous Chapters, both Upgrade editions grant access to the Gold Road Chapter. Note that to run Gold Road on PC/Mac, your machine needs to meet the game's requirements here: PC, Mac.

In addition to the game, both versions of Gold Road are also available in Deluxe editions, which feature a unique mount, pet, memento, outfit style, and emotes.

Gold Road Deluxe Edition items

To find out more about Gold Road and its editions, check out this blog.

Getting Started in Gold Road

Ready to venture into West Weald? You can travel to the new zone and begin your adventure in the following ways:

Via Wayshrine

You can teleport directly to the zone by accessing your map, selecting Gold Road, and then selecting the automatically unlocked Skingrad Vineyards Wayshrine.

Via the Gold Road Main Quest

You can have the game lead you to West Weald by picking up the Chapter's first main story quest, “Paths of Chaos.” You can find it by navigating to your Collections and then viewing Stories, selecting Chapter, and then Gold Road.

Via the Tutorial

You can also travel to West Weald by creating a new character and completing the tutorial. At the end of the tutorial experience, you can select the zone as your destination and begin.

Adventure awaits in Gold Road

Note that there are no level or story requirements for the Gold Road Chapter, allowing you to jump right in with any of your characters—existing or brand new!

Update 42

Launching in tandem with Gold Road is Update 42, a free base-game patch for all ESO players. Update 42 introduces a series of balance changes, fixes, and additions with no purchase required (beyond access to the game itself).

Improvements to In-game Mail

With Update 42, we've made a series of improvements to in-game mail, focusing on its interface and notifications. This includes the addition of categories (player mail, system mail, and system alerts), improved sorting, attachment preview, and inventory space display.

This update also adds a “Delete After Claim” option (helping you keep inboxes under control), a “Take All” function, and notifications for mail with attachments. In addition, messages received from your Hirelings will now be automatically recorded in the Lore Library under “Hireling Correspondence.”

Finally, as part of the team's efforts to improve server performance and stability, Update 42's mail changes also include reduced expiration times based on the mail types.

Environment Sustainability Features

With this update, we're joining Team Xbox in reducing our game's environmental impact with the following new features:

  • Reduced GPU use during periods of inactivity for PC/Mac, Xbox Series X|S, and PlayStation 5.
    • Reducing resolution and imposing a framerate cap during inactivity.
  • Screen dimming during periods of inactivity on PC/Mac.
    • Note that this already occurs on consoles.
  • Reduced GPU use in Contextual Menus for Xbox Series X|S and PlayStation 5.
    • When viewing most menus on consoles, the framerate is capped.

For more on Xbox's sustainability efforts, visit this page.

For everything changing and coming with Update 42, be sure to check out the patch notes on the official forums.

Forgotten No More

The Forgotten Prince walks Tamriel, and chaos follows in her wake. Investigate the emergence of Ithelia and confront her scions, explore the Colovian region of West Weald, and unlock and customize new abilities with the Scribing System in The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road. Tell us if you're excited to dive deep into this new Chapter via X (formerly Twitter), Instagram, and Facebook.

The Elder Scrolls Online: Gold Road is now live on PC/Mac, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 4, and PlayStation 5.

item.title: Crown Store Gifting Update – October 2023
item.content:encoded:
Following up on Studio Director Matt Firor's message last month about the current and future status of Crown Store Gifting, we are moving forward with re-enabling this functionality for eligible players at the account level. In this post, we will detail what to expect.

In September, we temporarily disabled Crown Store gifting due to a rapidly growing issue of "bad actors" using various fraudulent means to amass crowns without paying for them, then using them in turn to sell Crown Store items to players for real-world cash outside of the game client. That said, we recognize that gifting is a meaningful part of our community, and we are in the process of manually re-enabling Crown Store gifting access for select players who meet our specific criteria. This work will be complete tomorrow, October 11, during the maintenance window from 09:00 AM ET to 12:00 PM ET.

Gifting eligibility is determined by an evolving list of factors including but not limited to the account being at least 180 days past its first login and previous engagement with in-game features. You may check if you have access to gifting in-game via the Crown Store as well as via your billing history page in the ESO account center. If you have access to Crown Store gifting, you will see "Allow Crown Store Gifting" in your billing history. If you try to send a gift via the in-game Crown Store and do not have access, you will see a "Gifting Locked" pop-up message. Please note that we are exploring better ways to display this information in-game in the future, such as updating the Gifting Tutorial.

If you do not have access to Crown Store gifting after it is re-enabled on October 11, 2023, and wish for a review of your account, please visit https://help.elderscrollsonline.com and submit a Customer Support ticket. Please choose the Billing / Purchase / Code category then Platform > I have a question about a sale / offer > I want to send gift items from this account.

We appreciate everyone's understanding and patience while we get this solution up and running. Multiple teams have worked long hours to evaluate the best technical solutions that we could stand up in a reasonably short time, while also prioritizing the Crown Store gifting player experience. We are dedicated to continuing to explore ways to make this better and reduce fraudulent activity in ESO. Thanks again for being a part of our community and for your continued support.
